intro: Gundlachia corymbosa var. foliosa, commonly known as the leafy gundlachia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which bloom in summer, are usually pink to purple in color and are arranged in dense, branched clusters. This variant is distinguished by its more foliage-rich appearance compared to other forms of Gundlachia corymbosa.
